newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: Hermis up as Lithuanian share trade slides.
newsitem.headline: Hermis up as Lithuanian share trade slides.

text.p: Turnover dropped on the central market of Lithuania's bourse to 366,000 litas from 501,000 litas as indices were mixed.
Hermis Bank regained some ground, recovering to 180 litas from 175.90 on central market turnover of almost 100,000 litas.
"There is still a long time before the market gets a big boost from the outside or inside Lithuania," said Kestutis Kupshys, a broker with Mendes Prior Europe.
One broker saw continued stagnant turnover for next week.
"I do not expect high turnover," said Arvydas Jacikevichius, a broker with Suprema. "It's quiet as usual, but some prices recoverd today."
The official list advanced 6.32 points to 893.48 points. Group A shares eased 2.76 points to 1915.58 points.
Brokers say they are ready for a summer slow down but continue to watch individual shares, like Hermis Bank.
"Some prices will increase, one of them will be Ekranas," Jacikevichius said. "Another one will be Hermis, but I don't know if it will happen next week or not."
Ekranas advanced to 5.60 litas from 5.54 litas on central market turnover of 84,000 litas.
Brokers have had high hopes for Hermis, which posted positive results for the first four months of 1997 but share prices have so far been slow to respond.
Rival Vilniaus Bank stayed put at 224 litas in central market turnover of 67,000 litas.
